Verdence Capital Advisors LLC Raises Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Verdence Capital Advisors LLC Raises Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings 
plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
Newstex Blogs 
Zolmax.com
July 9, 2023 Sunday 11:05 AM EST
Delivered by Newstex LLC. All Rights Reserved
Copyright 2023 Zolmax.com 
Length: 753 words
Body
July 9th, 2023 ( Zolmax.com  — Delivered by  Newstex )
Verdence Capital Advisors LLC boosted its holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Free Report ) by 
111.7% in the 1st quarter, Holdings Channel  reports. The firm owned 8,910 shares of the transportation company's 
stock after purchasing an additional 4,701 shares during the period. Verdence Capital Advisors LLC's holdings in 
Ryanair were worth $840,000 as of its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
Several other institutional investors and hedge funds have also recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. 
HighTower Advisors LLC raised its position in Ryanair by 10.3% in the 1st quarter. HighTower Advisors LLC now 
owns 3,047 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $265,000 after purchasing an additional 285 
shares during the last quarter. Private Advisor Group LLC raised its position in Ryanair by 16.8% during the 1st 
quarter. Private Advisor Group LLC now owns 4,758 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $414,000 
after buying an additional 683 shares during the last quarter. Citigroup Inc. raised its position in Ryanair by 1.2% 
during the 1st quarter. Citigroup Inc. now owns 39,970 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$3,483,000 after buying an additional 483 shares during the last quarter. Bank of Montreal Can raised its position in 
Ryanair by 8.2% during the 1st quarter. Bank of Montreal Can now owns 11,691 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $984,000 after buying an additional 884 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Raymond 
James Trust N.A. increased its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 16.2% in the 1st quarter. Raymond James Trust 
N.A. now owns 3,406 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $297,000 after purchasing an 
additional 476 shares in the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 43.68% of the 
company's stock.
Ryanair Trading Up 0.9 %
RYAAY  opened at $107.82 on Friday. The firm has a market capitalization of $24.56 billion, a P/E ratio of 18.46, a 
P/E/G ratio of 0.92 and a beta of 1.44. The firm's 50 day moving average is $104.56 and its 200-day moving 
average is $95.79. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of $55.90 and a 52-week high of $111.78. The 
company has a quick ratio of 0.80, a current ratio of 0.80 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.51.
Verdence Capital Advisors LLC Raises Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Ryanair ( NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Free Report ) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Monday, May 22nd. The 
transportation company reported ($0.73) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus 
estimates of ($0.99) by $0.26. The business had revenue of $1.98 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst 
estimates of $1.91 billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 11.90% and a return on equity of 22.51%. Analysts expect 
that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 7.53 EPS for the current fiscal year.
Wall Street Analysts Forecast Growth
A number of brokerages have recently issued reports on RYAAY. StockNews.com  upgraded shares of Ryanair 
from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Friday, May 26th. Royal Bank of Canada started coverage on 
shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, June 27th. They set an "outperform" rating for the company. Stifel 
Nicolaus upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Wednesday, April 19th. 
Finally, Raymond James raised their target price on shares of Ryanair from $115.00 to $128.00 in a research report 
on Friday, June 2nd. One research analyst has rated the stock with a hold rating, seven have given a buy rating 
and one has assigned a strong buy rating to the company. According to data from MarketBeat.com, Ryanair 
presently has a consensus rating of "Buy" and an average price target of $46.50.
Ryanair Profile
( Free Report )
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, duty-
free, and merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its 
website and mobile app.

Transport strikes to hit rail and air in Italy next week
Transport strikes to hit rail and air in Italy next week
dpa international (Englischer Dienst)
July 9, 2023 Sunday 1:22 PM GMT
Copyright 2023 Deutsche Presse-Agentur All Rights Reserved
Length: 140 words
Dateline: Rome (dpa) - 
Body
Strikes at Italian air and rail service providers are set to go ahead at the end of the coming week, a number of trade 
unions indicated over the weekend.
Workers at the Trenitalia national rail company and its private competitor Italo are to stop working at 3 am (0100 
GMT) on Thursday for 23 hours, returning early on Friday morning.
The rail companies said many services would be cut, with long-distance travel hit hard. Passengers were advised to 
check connections shortly before travelling.
Ground staff are set to strike for eight hours from 10 am at airports on Saturday. Check-in desks will be affected.
Pilots at Malta Air, which operates Ryanair flights in Italy, are to strike for four hours from noon on Saturday.
And pilots and cabin staff working for budget carrier Vueling are to strike for eight hours starting at 10 am on 
Saturday.
Editorial contactsEditing by: Bill Heaney, <international@dpa.com;
Load-Date: July 9, 2023
End of Document
Transport strikes set to hit rail and air travel in Italy
Transport strikes set to hit rail and air travel in Italy
Alliance News UK
July 9, 2023 Sunday 11:32 AM GMT
Copyright 2023 Alliance News Limited All Rights Reserved
Length: 166 words
Body
(Alliance News) - Strikes at Italian air and rail service providers are set to go ahead at the end of the coming week, 
a number of trade unions indicated over the weekend.
Workers at the Trenitalia national rail company and its private competitor Italo are to stop working at 3 am local time 
on Thursday for 23 hours, returning early on Friday morning.
The rail companies said many services would be cut, with long-distance travel hit hard. Passengers were advised to 
check connections shortly before travelling.
Ground staff are set to strike for eight hours from 10 am at airports on Saturday. Check-in desks will be affected.
Pilots at Malta Air, which operates flights in Italy for Ryanair Holdings PLC, are to strike for four hours from noon on 
Saturday.
And pilots and cabin staff working for budget carrier Vueling, part of International Consolidated Airlines Group SA, 
are to strike for eight hours starting at 10 am on Saturday.
source: dpa
Copyright 2023 Alliance News Ltd. All Rights Reserved.

Transport strikes in Italy on July 13 and 15 (2) First trains then airport ground staff
Transport strikes in Italy on July 13 and 15 (2); First trains then airport 
ground staff
ANSA English Corporate Service
July 8, 2023 Saturday 3:39 PM CET
©Copyright 2023 ANSA All Rights Reserved
Length: 118 words
Dateline: ROME 
Body
(ANSA) - JUL 8 - Unions representing transport workers have announced two days of transport strikes on July 13 
and 15, union sources said on Saturday. On Thursday, the protest will involve rail workers employed by Trenitalia 
and Italo. On Saturday it will be the turn of airport ground staff, baggage handlers and check-in staff, who will walk 
out from 10 am until 6 pm in protest over the failure to renew their collective contract, which expired six years ago. 
stop for eight hours, from 10am to 6pm, as their contract has been expired for six years. Also on Saturday, pilots 
flying with Malta Air, which operates Ryanair flights, and the pilots and flight attendants of Vueling will also cross 
their arms.
Load-Date: July 8, 2023

European tourism enjoys boom - but for how long?
Financial Times (London, England)
July 8, 2023 Saturday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2023 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; FRONT PAGE; Pg. 1
Length: 77 words
Body
The travel industry is soaring. Hotels are savouring a rebound - even compared with the pre-Covid era - as tourists 
tolerate higher room rates. Airlines are also buoyant, with Ryanair and EASYJET both reporting 'robust' bookings 
and sentiment. Though many in the industry believe the boom may persist, others are more sceptical, saying that 
would-be holidaymakers' budgets will come under pressure from tightening economic conditions. Cork in the revels

Gol Linhas ( GOL ) Posts Impressive Traffic Numbers for June
Gol Linhas (GOL) Posts Impressive Traffic Numbers for June
Newstex Blogs 
Zacks Investment Research
July 7, 2023 Friday 5:01 PM EST
Delivered by Newstex LLC. All Rights Reserved
Copyright 2023 Zacks Investment Research
Length: 898 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Jul 07, 2023( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Gol Linhas Aereas Inteligentes S.A. (GOL) recently reported a double-digit year-over-year increase in traffic and 
capacity for June 2023. 
In June, consolidated revenue passenger kilometers (a measure of air traffic) and available seat kilometers (a 
measure of capacity) increased 14% and 15.4%, respectively, on a year-over-year basis. The load factor was 
75.7%. The number of flight departures at GOL in June registered a 20.8% year-over-year increase. Consolidated 
passengers on board rose 21% year over year. 
On the domestic front, with revenue passenger kilometers (12.9%) outpacing available seat kilometers (12.4%), the 
load factor increased to 76% from 75.7% in June 2023. 
Domestic departures, accounting for more than 95% of total departures during the month, grew 19.4% on a year-
over-year basis. On the domestic front, the number of seats increased 20.3% in June. International departures 
surged 62.1% in June on a year-over-year basis. The number of seats surged 65.1% internationally. 
On the domestic front, passengers on board rose 20.6% year over year. Internationally, the metric increased 31.2% 
year over year. 
Given the buoyant traffic scenario, Gol Linhas is not the only airline to report impressive traffic numbers for June. 
Ryanair Holdings RYAAY[1], a European carrier, also reported impressive traffic numbers for June 2023, driven by 
upbeat air-travel demand. The number of passengers ferried on RYAAY flights in June was 17.4 million. This 
compared favorably with the May 2023 figure of 17 million and 15.9 million in June 2022. Owing to upbeat traffic, 
the load factor (percentage of seats filled by passengers) was high at 95% in June 2023. The reading was similar a 
year ago. RYAAY operated more than 96,250 flights in June 2023. Zacks Rank & Key Picks Gol Linhas currently 
carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). 
Some better-ranked stocks for investors interested in the Zacks Transportation[2] sector are Copa Holdings CPA[3] 
and CSX Corporation CSX[4]. Copa Holdings sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), while CSX carries a Zacks 
Rank #2 (Buy). You can see the complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank stocks here[5]. 
Copa Holdings has an expected earnings growth rate of 75.42% for the current year. CPA delivered a trailing four-
quarter earnings surprise of 14.60%, on average. 
Gol Linhas ( GOL ) Posts Impressive Traffic Numbers for June
The Zacks Consensus Estimate for CPA's current-year earnings has improved 25.5% over the past 90 days. 
Shares of CPA have soared 32.5% over the past six months. 
CSX has an expected earnings growth rate of 2.09% for the current year. CSX delivered a trailing four-quarter 
earnings surprise of 7.76%, on average. 
The Zacks Consensus Estimate for CSX's current-year earnings has improved 4.3% over the past 90 days. Shares 
of CSX have gained 6.6% over the past six months.

Ryanair Agrees to Pay $10,800 Compensation to Schoolboy for "Terrifying Ordeal" on Flight
Ryanair Agrees to Pay $10,800 Compensation to Schoolboy for "Terrifying 
Ordeal" on Flight
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
July 06, 2023
Copyright 2023 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News - Airlines; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 321 words
Body
Irish ultra-low-cost carrier Ryanair has been ordered to pay (EURO)10,000 ($10,800) to a schoolboy who suffered a 
"terrifying ordeal" onboard a flight in 2018.
Stefan Kokic, now aged 17 (but aged 11 during the incident), was on a Ryanair flight in 2018 from Dublin Airport 
(DUB) to Croatia's Zadar Airport (ZAD) when the aircraft had to make an emergency landing into Frankfurt-Hahn 
Airport (HHN) after the cabin experienced loss of pressure.
According to the Irish Examiner, Barrister Ciaran Mandal told Judge John O'Connor in the Circuit Civil Court on July 
3, 2023 that Kokic underwent a "terrifying ordeal" because of the incident.
"Stefan was involved in an undoubtedly terrifying ordeal," Mandal said.
The 17-year-old had sued Ryanair through his mother, Nikolina Kokic who said in an affidavit that her son had 
suffered emotional upset as a result of the accident but had dealt well with the experience.
Following the incident, Stefan visited his physician twice, and was diagnosed with a degree of stress secondary to 
the incident as well as headaches.
The claim was brought under the Montreal Convention which states the event that occurred had to be an accident 
and the complainant had to have suffered bodily injury in order to recover damages.
Mandal said the airline had belatedly conceded the event was an accident.
On July 3, 2023, Judge John O'Connor in the Circuit Civil Court ordered Ryanair to issue a (EURO)10,000 
settlement offer on the basis of "outstanding issues".
